TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a limited liability company , ORG ( “ ORG ” ) , hired the applicant as an accountant .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG granted the applicant an interest - free loan for the purchase of a ORG Land Cruiser car . The terms and conditions of the loan were set out in a loan agreement of DATE signed by the applicant and the director - general of ORG , PERSON PERSON . The loan was for MONEY * ( “ RUR ” ) over a period of DATE . On DATE the total amount was transferred directly to the bank account of the car dealer .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the GPE Region registered the purchased car in the applicant 's name .

CARDINAL . According to an undated certificate signed by the new ORG director - general , PERSON , the applicant reimbursed CARDINAL instalments of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( after denomination ) DATE and DATE and one additional instalment of RUR CARDINAL in DATE , to the total of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE convicted PERSON and the applicant 's husband , PERSON , of large - scale fraud . The applicant was a witness at the trial . It was established that the accused , while holding managerial positions in the ORG telecommunication company ORG , had founded the ORG company that acted as a broker in the procurement of telecommunication equipment for ORG . They used the ORG 's funds to make advance payments under the contracts for the purchase of telephones signed by ORG and then sold these telephones to ORG at inflated prices . The court found :

“ Being managers of ORG , PERSON and PERSON ... used their position ... to take advantage of the cash flow of [ the ORG ] for their personal gain . Moreover , relatives of the defendants were simultaneously employees of the ORG and ORG and they received a salary from both companies . It was established by the court ... that the salary of the ORG employees , loans and dividends were paid out of money that had been taken from [ the ORG ] ” .
CARDINAL . The court noted that the applicant had not shown the loan agreement to the investigator and held :

“ As it was established by the court that the loans for the purchase of cars had been granted to PERSON and [ the applicant ] unlawfully , at the expense of [ the ORG ] , without appropriate documentation , the court considers it necessary to order forfeiture of the cars as compensation for the damage ( обратить в возмещение ущерба ) ” .

CARDINAL . The court sentenced both Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON to DATE imprisonment and issued confiscation orders in respect of their property . It also recovered ORG from them and ordered forfeiture of the ORG company 's cash funds and the applicant 's and Mr PERSON 's cars as compensation for the damage .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's car was seized . On DATE certain household items in the applicant 's flat were also seized .
CARDINAL . The applicant brought a civil action , seeking to lift the seizure order in respect of her household items and the car .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE granted the applicant 's action in respect of the household items but upheld the seizure of the car , finding as follows :

“ The court has established that on DATE the ORG company and [ the applicant ] concluded a loan agreement , by the terms of which [ the applicant ] was granted a loan of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ... It is true that , according to the sale certificate of DATE and a copy of the vehicle registration card , the car at issue was registered in [ the applicant 's ] name . However , the court considers that the plaintiff 's arguments to the effect that she is the legal owner of the car ... are unsubstantiated because the judgment of ORG of GPE of DATE ... had established that the loan for the purchase of that car had been granted unlawfully and , accordingly , the car had been forfeited as compensation for damage . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG , on an appeal by the applicant , upheld the judgment of DATE . The court justified the seizure of the car in the following terms :

“ The [ first - instance ] court correctly refused [ the applicant 's ] claim ... because the circumstances showing that [ the applicant ] had purchased the car from her own ( borrowed ) money had not been confirmed ... [ T]here is no evidence that the borrowed funds were used for the purchase of the car , the loan was only reimbursed from [ the applicant 's ] salary and the last instalment was paid on DATE ” .
CARDINAL . The Civil Code of GPE provides :

CARDINAL . Where the law so provides , property may upon a court decision be taken away from its owner without compensation by way of punishment for commission of a crime or another offence ( confiscation ) .

CARDINAL . Where the law so provides , a confiscation order may be issued in administrative proceedings . The decision on confiscation made in the administrative proceedings may be appealed against to a court . ”

CARDINAL . LAW of the Russian Federation provides that “ punishment shall be imposed on a person found guilty of commission of a crime ” . DATE ( g ) provides that confiscation is a form of punishment . LAW confiscation of property as the “ compulsory withdrawal , in whole or in part , without compensation , of the property owned by the convicted person ” .

CARDINAL . The RSFSR Code on Administrative Offences ( in force at the material time ) provided for the confiscation of things by means of which the administrative offence had been committed or which had been the object of the offence .

CARDINAL . The RSFSR Code of Criminal Procedure ( in force at the material time ) provided that instruments of the crime which belonged to the defendant ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) and criminally acquired money and other valuables were to be forfeited whereas other items were to be returned to their lawful owner ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
